Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Rodent \Ro"dent\, a. [L. rodens, -entis, p. pr. of rodere to gnaw. See {Rase}, v. t., and cf. {Rostrum}.] 1. Gnawing; biting; corroding; (Med.) applied to a destructive variety of cancer or ulcer. [1913 Webster]
2. (Zo["o]l.) (a) Gnawing. (b) Of or pertaining to the Rodentia. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Rodent \Ro"dent\, n. (Zo["o]l.) One of the Rodentia. [1913 Webster]
rodent n : relatively small gnawing animals having a single pair of constantly growing incisor teeth specialized for gnawing [syn: {gnawer}, {gnawing animal}]
